dbb97215-6ff1-448f-8772-5f17313fc9f0.title: THE KINDERHOOK PLATES
dbb97215-6ff1-448f-8772-5f17313fc9f0.lyrics:
[Intro - Spoken, carnival barker style]
Gather round, gather round!
The year is eighteen-forty-three
And some gentlemen in Kinderhook
Have devised a test, you see!
They've made some plates from brass and copper
Etched with made-up marks
Let's see if the prophet can translate
These forgeries for larks!

[Verse 1]
In Kinderhook, Illinois
Some fellas had a plan
They said "Let's test this Joseph Smith
This translation man!"
So they took some copper plates
And etched some random signs
Buried them and dug them up
To see if he'd take the bait this time!

[Pre-Chorus - Spoken rhythmically]
They brought them to the prophet
(The prophet!)
Said "Look what we just found!"
(In the ground!)
"Can you tell us what they say?"
(Please translate!)
"With your gift so heavenly profound?"

[Chorus - Big and brassy]
They're the Kinderhook Plates!
Fresh out of the dirt!
Joseph took one look and said
"I'll tell you what they're worth!"
"I have translated a portion!"
(He wrote it in his journal!)
"It's the descendant of Ham!"
(This translation's quite eternal!)

Kinderhook Plates! Kinderhook Plates!
The prophet took the bait!
Kinderhook Plates! Kinderhook Plates!
The hoaxers couldn't wait!

[Verse 2]
William Clayton wrote it down
In the prophet's history
"Joseph has translated part"
For all the world to see
He said they're ancient records
Of Ham's posterity
But the gentlemen who made them
Were laughing with great glee!

[Pre-Chorus - Spoken, building excitement]
One of them confessed it
(Confessed it!)
"We made them as a joke!"
(As a joke!)
"We wanted to expose him!"
(Expose him!)
"And boy, did he just choke!"

[Chorus]
They're the Kinderhook Plates!
Made in forty-three!
Joseph said they're ancient
(Modern forgery!)
Etched by local blacksmiths
With made-up hieroglyphs
But Joseph started translating
And that's where the story shifts!

Kinderhook Plates! Kinderhook Plates!
A nineteenth-century prank!
Kinderhook Plates! Kinderhook Plates!
The prophet walked the plank!

[Bridge - Slows down, mock serious]
Now the church says "Hold on there
He never really translated!"
But William Clayton wrote it down
The history clearly stated
"I have translated a portion"
In Joseph's history book
But now we'll say he didn't
Just don't take a closer look!

[Spoken, building back up]

c7234c12-a1aa-41c0-8248-ac628b741ea3.title: Naughty by Midnight
c7234c12-a1aa-41c0-8248-ac628b741ea3.style:
Genre: Funk-Disco Pop
Mood: Flirty • Charismatic • Late-Night Cool
Tempo: 120 BPM
c7234c12-a1aa-41c0-8248-ac628b741ea3.lyrics:
Clock strikes twelve, lights turn low,
Some secrets only I can know.
(Shh…)
You’ve been good — but I’ve seen more,
Now show me what that halo’s for.

You move like mischief wrapped in gold,
A little danger in the cold.
Cinnamon lips and velvet tone,
You turn this sleigh into your throne.

Whispers fall like snow tonight,
Each one burns a little bright.
You said “be nice,” I said, “we’ll see,”
Then you leaned right into me.

No fireplace, but I feel heat,
Every step pulls off the sheet.
The clock’s about to take its bite —
Let’s see who you are tonight.

Naughty by midnight, we lose control,
Golden hour for the winter soul.
Don’t need the stars, we make our own light,
You and me get naughty by midnight.

Naughty by midnight, hearts collide,
Snow outside but it’s warm inside.
One last toast before first light —
You and me get naughty by midnight.

You say “I’m not the type to break,”
But rules are gifts you love to take.
Every glance says what we mean,
Wrapped in red and tangerine.

Velvet air and disco haze,
You’ve got that “don’t look away” gaze.
If there’s a line, we crossed it twice,
And it feels exactly right.

No fireplace, but I feel heat,
Every move just feeds the beat.
The clock’s about to take its bite —
Let’s see who you are tonight.

Naughty by midnight, we lose control,
Golden hour for the winter soul.
Don’t need the stars, we make our own light,
You and me get naughty by midnight.

Naughty by midnight, hearts collide,
Snow outside but it’s warm inside.
One last toast before first light —
You and me get naughty by midnight.

It’s not about bad or good,
It’s about the spark that understood.
No gift could match this sight,
You — in the glow of midnight.

Naughty by midnight, let it unfold,
Silver skin, red lips, bold.
The clock can strike, we won’t fight,
You and me stay naughty by midnight.

Naughty by midnight, one last song,
We’ve been waiting all year long.
When the world sleeps, we ignite —
You and me get naughty by midnight.

(Oh… midnight never felt so right.)2010 / 7500

27ab2bfa-0461-464f-a6ff-ffa2db945b66.title: Naughty by Midnight
27ab2bfa-0461-464f-a6ff-ffa2db945b66.lyrics:
[Intro — bass pops, sleigh bells, crowd chatter]
[Santa laugh — deep and playful]
Snow’s fallin’, drinks are pourin’,
You’ve been nice — but baby, that’s boring.
(Oh-ho-ho!)
You want the list? Come take a bite,
Let’s get a little naughty by midnight.

[Verse 1]
I saw you dancin’ by the cookie tray,
Candy-cane hips in a dangerous way.
Eggnog smile with a hint of bite,
(You’re on the list for tonight.)

Red lights glow, mistletoe sway,
You whispered, “Santa, make me stay.”
Now I don’t rush, I take my time,
Midnight’s when you cross the line.

[Pre-Chorus — horns teasing, rhythm builds]
You’ve been so good, that’s such a shame,
Let’s twist the rules of the reindeer game.
I’ll check it once, I’ll check it twice,
We both know bad feels nice.

[Chorus — full drop, big funky bounce]
Naughty by midnight (hey!),
Snow’s still fallin’, but you’re red hot tonight.
Sip that cheer, make it right,
Let’s all get naughty by midnight.

Naughty by midnight (woo!),
Kiss me quick in the disco light.
We’ll make this nice list lose its fight —
Everybody’s naughty by midnight!

[Verse 2]
Mrs. C said, “Don’t stay out late,”
But baby, this groove just sealed my fate.
You’ve got that sparkle, you’ve got that shine,
Wrap it up — I’ll make it mine.

DJ spinnin’ “Let It Snow,”
We’re spinnin’ closer, head to toe.
One more drink, one more rhyme,
We’ll rewrite Christmas line by line.

[Pre-Chorus]
You’ve been so good, that’s such a shame,
Let’s twist the rules of the reindeer game.
I’ll check it once, I’ll check it twice,
We both know bad feels nice.

[Chorus — party chant version]
Naughty by midnight (hey!),
Snow’s still fallin’, but you’re red hot tonight.
Sip that cheer, make it right,
Let’s all get naughty by midnight.

Naughty by midnight (woo!),
Kiss me quick in the disco light.
We’ll make this nice list lose its fight —
Everybody’s naughty by midnight!

[Post-Chorus — crowd chant / call + response]
(Santa say what?) Naughty!
(Sleigh bells ringin’?) Party!
(Ho-ho-ho?) Hardly!
We’re naughty, naughty, naughty by midnight!

[Bridge — breakdown groove, horns + bass]
[Santa laugh over beat]
You’ve been bad, but don’t confess,
Santa likes a little mess.
Wrap it up with velvet bows,
Nobody here needs mistletoe.

[Final Chorus — full blast, confetti energy]
Naughty by midnight (hey!),
Snow’s still fallin’, but you’re red hot tonight.
Raise that glass, feel that bite,
We’re all gettin’ naughty by midnight!

Naughty by midnight (woo!),
Lights come low, but the vibe’s still bright.
Ring those bells, hold on tight,
Everybody’s naughty by midnight!

[Outro — funky bass outro + crowd cheer]
(Ho-ho-ho… you made the nice list fun again.)2642 / 7500

5a35caee-944a-46d3-a095-253e98f7a92b.title: Thaw Me Out
5a35caee-944a-46d3-a095-253e98f7a92b.lyrics:
Boots off jacket on the floor
Icicles outside but I want more
Been frozen all December long
Come turn me on like a holiday song

Temperature is subzero out there
But you're making steam fill up the air

Thaw me out thaw me out till I'm melting down
Heat me up spin me round on this winter ground
Thaw me out thaw me out make me lose control
Defrost my body warm up my soul
(Melt it! Melt it!)
Thaw me out tonight
(Yeah yeah yeah!)

Frostbite never felt so right
When you're holding me this tight
Snow is falling by the feet
But we're generating all the heat

Ice queen melting in your hands
Move with me to the winter jam

Thaw me out thaw me out till I'm melting down
Heat me up spin me round on this winter ground
Thaw me out thaw me out make me lose control
Defrost my body warm up my soul
(Melt it! Melt it!)
Thaw me out tonight
(Yeah yeah yeah!)

Frozen solid all day long...
Melt me down till the ice is gone...
Steam is rising can you feel...
This winter heat is so unreal...

Thaw me out thaw me out till I'm melting down
Heat me up spin me round on this winter ground
Thaw me out thaw me out make me lose control
Defrost my body warm up my soul
Thaw me out thaw me out let the winter burn
Make the season take a heated turn
(Oooh thaw me out!)

Thaw me... thaw me... thaw me out!1288 / 7500

6b534900-a0a6-4006-8bff-d5d693150f64.title: Hibernate
6b534900-a0a6-4006-8bff-d5d693150f64.lyrics:
January wind cuts through the bone
Found your warmth when the world turned stone
Draw the curtains let the darkness fall
We don't need anything at all

The wolves are sleeping underground
And we won't make a sound


Come hibernate with me
Where the winter can't reach
Bury deep beneath the sheets
Let our bodies be the heat
Hibernate hibernate
Till the spring decides our fate
(Ooooh till the snow melts away...)

Bare trees scratching at the glass
Time moves different when we're wrapped
In this den we've made from skin
Where the cold can't get in

The world is frozen all around
But we're safe here underground

Come hibernate with me
Where the winter can't reach
Bury deep beneath the sheets
Let our bodies be the heat
Hibernate hibernate
Till the spring decides our fate
(Ooooh till the snow melts away...)

When the bears retreat to caves
When the darkness holds for days
We'll be wrapped in something primal
Something ancient something vital
Nature knows what we need
(Plant the seed... plant the seed...)

Come hibernate with me
Where the winter can't reach
Bury deep beneath the sheets
Let our bodies be the heat
Hibernate hibernate
Till the spring decides our fate
Hibernate with me tonight
In the depth of winter's bite
(Oooooh we'll survive...)

Through the cold... through the dark...
We keep each other... warm at heart...1336 / 7500

b35307b0-8dfc-40b5-919b-2a9b7e79651f.title: The List Is a Lie
b35307b0-8dfc-40b5-919b-2a9b7e79651f.style:
Genre: Funk-Pop / Modern Soul Groove
Mood: Playful • Seductive • Confessional
Tempo: 116 BPM
b35307b0-8dfc-40b5-919b-2a9b7e79651f.lyrics:
[Intro — tight bass groove, finger snaps, sleigh bells under beat]
[low Santa chuckle]
You think I’m checkin’ twice tonight?
(Guess again.)
This list… is a lie.

[Verse 1]
Every year, I play the part,
Mr. Perfect, holly heart.
Red coat clean, white gloves neat,
But I’ve got secrets under this seat.

You left cookies, I left charm,
You said “be good,” I meant “no harm.”
But when the lights go low, I sigh —
I don’t believe my own alibi.

[Pre-Chorus — groove builds, horns tease]
You’ve been told that nice gets gifts,
But baby, truth comes with a twist.
Those halos never caught my eye —
It’s time you knew the reason why.

[Chorus — big disco-funk drop, layered vocals]
The list is a lie, don’t act surprised,
It’s the sinners that light up my sky.
All those rules I’m supposed to apply,
Guess what, baby — the list is a lie.

The list is a lie, I won’t deny,
Good girls fade and bad ones fly.
Keep your secret, I won’t try,
‘Cause you know, baby — the list is a lie.

[Verse 2]
Candy cane lips, that crooked smile,
You’ve been guilty all the while.
Heaven’s fine, but it don’t groove,
You’re the reason I learned to move.

You broke the rules, I changed the game,
You made “bad” a better name.
They think I judge from way on high,
But I’m right here — eye to eye.

[Pre-Chorus]
You’ve been told that nice gets gifts,
But baby, truth comes with a twist.
All those halos passing by —
Don’t shine like you, don’t even try.

[Chorus — funkier, crowd joining in]
The list is a lie, don’t act surprised,
It’s the sinners that light up my sky.
All those rules I’m supposed to apply,
Guess what, baby — the list is a lie.

The list is a lie, I won’t deny,
Good girls fade and bad ones fly.
Keep your secret, I won’t try,
‘Cause you know, baby — the list is a lie.

[Bridge — breakdown groove, spoken rhythm over beat]
[Santa voice — smooth, playful]
They say I’m watchin’ all the time —
(Only when it’s worth the climb.)
I don’t need angels to testify,
Just one spark to justify.

[soft chorus echo builds under him]
(The list is a lie…)

[Final Chorus — full horns, layered harmonies, handclaps]
The list is a lie, don’t act surprised,
It’s the wild ones I can’t deny.
Good hearts bend, and bad ones try —
And that’s why, baby, the list is a lie.

The list is a lie, no alibi,
No coal tonight, just fire and sky.
You caught my eye, don’t ask me why —
You just proved, baby — the list is a lie.

[Outro — funky fade, Santa hums over groove]
(Ho-ho-ho…)
(You knew all along.)
[fade with bass + sleigh bells]2503 / 7500

c65212bd-2b8d-4fbe-9a3c-e40e0ec3d44d.title: Nightrun
c65212bd-2b8d-4fbe-9a3c-e40e0ec3d44d.description: You can leave the church but can you outrun the voices? Synthwave for
c65212bd-2b8d-4fbe-9a3c-e40e0ec3d44d.lyrics:
They're in the rearview riding close tonight
Voices I know by heart
"Where will you go when the road runs out?"
"You were the chosen one"

I can't look back but I feel their eyes
Headlights on the bloodline

Rearview prophets fading in the red
Every mile another thing they said
I was built to stay
I was made to kneel
Now I'm just a ghost behind the wheel

Mom's in the backseat praying for my soul
Dad's disappointment rides shotgun
The bishop's asking where I think I'll go
My younger self says "run"

The static's thick but I can still hear
Every warning ringing clear

Rearview prophets fading in the red
Every mile another thing they said
I was built to stay
I was made to kneel
Now I'm just a ghost behind the wheel

"We only wanted what was best for you"
"You'll come back when the world breaks you"
"You'll see... you'll see..."

Rearview prophets swallowed by the night
Every mile I'm letting go the fight
I was built to stay
I was made to kneel
Now I'm something real behind the wheel995 / 7500

a906690e-9483-46fa-9025-2de4419a26b6.title: Adam Is Our God
a906690e-9483-46fa-9025-2de4419a26b6.description: In 1852, LDS Prophet Brigham Young declared "Adam is our Father and ou
a906690e-9483-46fa-9025-2de4419a26b6.lyrics:
[Intro - Acoustic guitar, sparse, building]

[Verse 1]
April, eighteen fifty-two
Salt Lake Tabernacle, General Conference
The prophet clears his throat and says
"Now hear it, O inhabitants of the earth"

[Verse 2]
"When our father Adam came to Eden
He came with a celestial body
Brought Eve, one of his wives, with him
Michael, the Archangel, Ancient of Days"

[Chorus - Building intensity]
Adam is our Father
Adam is our God
The only God with whom we have to do
Sooner or later, sooner or later
Every man will know it's true

[Verse 3]
"Pause before you make light of these words
Don't treat them with indifference
For they will prove your salvation
Or they will prove your damnation"

[Chorus]
Adam is our Father
Adam is our God
The only God with whom we have to do
Sooner or later, sooner or later
Every man will know it's true

[Bridge - Pulls back, then builds]
One hundred twenty years go by
Nineteen seventy-six arrives
President Kimball takes the stand
"We denounce that theory"
That's the church's final word

[Final Chorus - Full, then pulling back]
Adam was our Father
Adam was our God
The only God with whom we had to do
Sooner or later, sooner or later

84f0e2e0-19ab-453f-a99b-b63678fd2119.lyrics:
[Intro - Slow Hammond organ, somber]

[Verse 1] 
Sunday afternoon in Provo 
August, eighteen eighty-one 
The prophet rose to tell them 
What their God had done 
He spoke of Noah's flood
And why the curse survived
"Why did it pass through the water?"
Then the answer he supplied 

[Chorus]
The devil needs representation
That's what the prophet told
God designed it, God required it
A people bought and sold
The curse of Cain through Ham's own wife
Preserved by heaven's hand
The devil needs representation
So sayeth the promised land 

[Verse 2] 
"It was necessary," said the prophet
Speaking plain and speaking clear 
Not whispered, not in private 
But for every soul to hear
Published in the Journal
For the faithful to receive 
The devil needs his people
That's what you're supposed to believe

[Chorus]
The devil needs representation
That's what the prophet told
God designed it, God required it
A people bought and sold
The curse of Cain through Ham's own wife
Preserved by heaven's hand
The devil needs representation
So sayeth the promised land 

[Bridge - Tempo slows, choir enters soft]
Two thousand thirteen 
An essay finally came 
"We disavow the theories" 
But they never spoke his name 
The devil's representation
Now just "theories of the past" 
But for ninety-seven years
Those theories held fast

  [Final Chorus]                                                                                                                              
  The devil had representation                                                                                                                
  For ninety-seven years they bore the ban                                                                                                    
  No priesthood, no temple, no promised land                                                                                                  
  That's what they told the children of God                                                                                                   
  "Why did it last so long?" we ask                                                                                                           
  The prophets never told

should have a representation upon the earth"

e8802fd6-bdcf-4e04-973a-73279109dfae.title: Death on the Spot
e8802fd6-bdcf-4e04-973a-73279109dfae.description: In 1863, Brigham Young declared interracial marriage punishable by "de
e8802fd6-bdcf-4e04-973a-73279109dfae.lyrics:
[Intro - Somber piano, slow tempo]

[Verse 1 - Spoken word style, building into melody]
March eighth, eighteen sixty-three
Tabernacle, Salt Lake City
Prophet stands before the congregation
"Shall I tell you," he begins
"Shall I tell you the law of God?"
Everyone leans in to listen

[Verse 2 - Melody establishes, minor key]
"In regard to the African race"
His voice is steady, certain, clear
"If the white man of the chosen seed
Mixes his blood with the seed of Cain"
He pauses for the weight to land
"The penalty, under the law of God..."

[Chorus - Full, powerful, deliberate]
Death on the spot
Death on the spot
This is the law of God, he says
This will always be so
Always be so
Death on the spot
This will always be so

[Verse 3 - Building intensity]
Civil War is raging, nation torn
"I'm no abolitionist," he claims
"Neither am I pro-slavery"
Standing in the middle ground
Then declares that love across the line
Deserves death by divine command

[Chorus]
Death on the spot
Death on the spot
This is the law of God, he says
This will always be so
Always be so
Death on the spot
This will always be so

[Bridge - Tempo slows, piano solo, then spoken/sung]
One hundred and fifty years pass
December, two thousand thirteen
The church releases a quiet statement
"We disavow the theories advanced in the past"
"That mixed-race marriages are a sin"
The law of God...
Was just a theory?

[Verse 4 - Quiet, testimonial]
Today in temples, all across the land
Interracial couples kneel and pray
Sealed for time and all eternity
By the same church that declared
Their love deserved death on the spot
Under the eternal law of God

[Final Chorus - Raw, powerful]
Death on the spot
He said death on the spot
This is the law of God
This will always be so
But always meant
One hundred and fifty years
Till it was too embarrassing
To keep saying so

[Outro - Piano fading, spoken]
"This will always be so"
(Repeat, growing quieter)
"This will always be so"
"This will always..."
[Silence]1978 / 7500

2bdc6489-b7cb-4dc0-9ba9-3bf0064a74fb.title: Flat Nose and Black Skin
2bdc6489-b7cb-4dc0-9ba9-3bf0064a74fb.style: Somber blues, spiritual, gospel, mournful testimony
2bdc6489-b7cb-4dc0-9ba9-3bf0064a74fb.description: Documenting racist theology taught by the LDS Church in 1859, when Bri
2bdc6489-b7cb-4dc0-9ba9-3bf0064a74fb.lyrics:
[Intro: Somber acoustic guitar, fingerpicked, haunting]

[Verse 1: Speak-sing, testimony voice]
October morning, eighteen fifty-nine
Brigham stood in the Tabernacle, said he'd gather truth divine
"God has created of one blood," he told the gathered crowd
"All the nations, black and white, copper-colored" — spoke it loud

[Pre-Chorus: Building]
But then he taught intelligence
And what the Lord had shown
About the classes of the human race
And curses set in stone

[Chorus: Full voice, letting horror speak]
Flat nose and black skin
That's the mark the Lord put on
Uncouth, un-comely, disagreeable
The curse of Cain lives on
Flat nose and black skin
Deprived of blessings from above
This is what the prophet taught
In the name of God's own love

[Verse 2: Measured, each word weighted]
"Cain slew his brother Abel, committed odious crime
He'll be cursed the longest of any child of Adam's line
The Lord put a mark upon him" — Brigham made it plain
The flat nose and the black skin is the curse upon that stain

[Bridge: Sparse, haunting, space between lines]
One hundred nineteen years
The priesthood was denied
One hundred nineteen years
While Black Saints testified

Children couldn't be sealed
To mothers and to fathers
One hundred nineteen years
Of theological slaughter

[Verse 3: The reckoning]
Nineteen seventy-eight, June
The revelation came
Black members could hold the priesthood now
But no apology for shame

Twenty thirteen, an essay
Disavows the theories taught
"Black skin is not divine disfavor"
But what about what it wrought?

[Final Chorus: Quieter, bearing witness]
Flat nose and black skin
That's what Brigham Young declared
The mark of Cain, the curse of God
One hundred nineteen years they bared

The church disavows it now
Says racism in any form
But for a century and more
This teaching was the norm

[Outro: Instrumental, fading, unresolved]1868 / 7500

d69dbaa5-7740-4ded-b19f-d3508c7664a2.title: The Only Men Who Become Gods
d69dbaa5-7740-4ded-b19f-d3508c7664a2.style: Dark americana, gospel-rock, doubtful male voice
d69dbaa5-7740-4ded-b19f-d3508c7664a2.description: Documenting prophetic doctrine taught by Brigham Young in 1866, declar
d69dbaa5-7740-4ded-b19f-d3508c7664a2.lyrics:
[Intro - Sparse, Building]
Eighteen sixty-six, Bowery heat
Prophet to the pulpit, truth to speak
Every word preserved, every promise made
Listen close to what the prophet said

[Verse 1 - Authoritative, Delivered Like Scripture]
I know it is from God, I know it came from heaven
I understand the bearings, I know why it was given
As true as that God lives, I say to all the world--
The only men who become Gods are those with many pearls

[Pre-Chorus - Building Tension]
Polygamists, at least in your faith
Or come short of the glory Abraham attained
They offered you the blessing, you turned it away
You cannot reign as kings, no matter what you pray

[Chorus - Anthemic, Heavy]
The only men who become Gods
Are those who enter polygamy
The only men who become Gods--
That's what the prophet said to me
Others reach a glory, might see the Father's face
But they cannot reign as kings
They refused and lost their place

[Verse 2 - Shift to Modern, Quieter, Confused Tone]
Now a couple walks to the temple door
Monogamous and faithful, seeking something more
Promised exaltation, sealed for time and all
But Brigham said they cannot--they refused the call

[Pre-Chorus - Return of Tension]
The scripture stays, the practice goes
One of them was wrong, heaven knows
Either the prophet spoke the truth in sixty-six
Or the modern promise is a cruel trick

[Chorus - Anthemic, Heavy]
The only men who become Gods
Are those who enter polygamy
The only men who become Gods--
That's what the prophet said to me
Others reach a glory, might see the Father's face
But they cannot reign as kings
They refused and lost their place

[Bridge - Dramatic, Building, Spoken-Word Style Over Music]
"Do you think we'll be admitted without denying it?
If we are not admitted until then--
We shall never be admitted."

(Pause, then music swells)

Eighteen ninety, gave it up
Eighteen ninety-six, statehood won
The government came calling
And "never" came undone

[Final Chorus - Full Power, Adding Harmonies]
The only men who become Gods
Are those who enter polygamy
The only men who become Gods--
That's what the prophet said to me
Modern couples at the altar, promised heaven's crown
But Brigham said they cannot--
Unless they take more vows

[Outro - Fading, Haunting]
As true as that God lives...
As true as that God lives...
One of them was wrong
One of them was wrong

[End]2358 / 7500

30bfd9b4-7e3f-45d5-a2f9-b93e972f0f42.title: As God Once Was
30bfd9b4-7e3f-45d5-a2f9-b93e972f0f42.description: The King Follett Discourse - Joseph Smith's magnum opus, delivered 81
30bfd9b4-7e3f-45d5-a2f9-b93e972f0f42.lyrics:
[Intro - Atmospheric, building cosmic soundscape]
[Piano and strings gradually layer in][Soft drums begin to pulse]

[Verse 1 - Building, confident, storytelling]
April seventh, eighteen forty-four
A funeral sermon, but something more
King Follett's dead, the mourners weep
But Joseph has a secret to keep
He stands before the temple, tall
"I'll tell you now the truth of all"
"I'm going to tell you," hear him say
"How God came to be God this day"

[Pre-Chorus - Rising]
Eight thousand souls beneath the sky
"The great secret—I will not hide"
"If I fail to do it, understand,
I'll renounce my prophetic stand"

[Chorus - Massive, anthemic]
God himself was once as we are now
An exalted man upon his mortal brow
You have got to learn to be gods, don't you see?
The same as all gods have done—eternally
The head of the gods called a council to meet
Concocted the plan, made creation complete
This is the secret, the truth profound—
As man is now, God once was found

[Verse 2 - Declarative, building intensity]
"God the Father dwelt on earth like you,
The same as Jesus Christ, this much is true
He laid down his body, his life, his breath
Then took it up again—conquered death"
"God never had the power to create your soul—
Intelligence eternal is the whole"
"From age to age, self-existent, free—
Co-equal with God in eternity"

[Verse 3 - Joseph's grandiosity]
[Slight key change, building to peak]
"I have the Bible in four tongues," he proclaimed
"Hebrew, Latin, German, Greek—I'm not ashamed"
"I am learned, know more than all the world combined"
"The Holy Ghost is in me—he's not blind"
"I shall comment on the very first word
Of Genesis itself—let truth be heard
And if I fail, let my calling cease—
But I won't fail—I bring you peace"

[Pre-Chorus - Powerful]
"From one small degree to the next you'll climb
From a small capacity to glory sublime
From grace to grace, exaltation to exaltation rise
Until you sit enthroned in the skies"

[Chorus Variation - Peak energy, triumphant]
God himself was once as we are now
(He spoke with power, solemn vow)
You have got to learn to be gods, all agree
(The same as all gods have done—can't you see?)
The head of the gods—yes, gods, plural, more—
Called a council divine from heaven's floor
This is the secret that sets us free—
As God is now, man may be

[Extended Bridge - Tonal shift, stripped down arrangement]
[Music drops to piano and soft strings]
[Spoken-word quality, uncertain]

Eighty-one days later—Carthage Jail
The prophet's voice would tell no more tale
But the teaching spread through Zion's land
Lorenzo Snow confirmed it: understand—
"As man now is, God once was,
As God now is, man may be"—this was the cause

[Music builds slightly - adding bass, drums]

A century passes, then comes the test
A reporter asks the prophet blessed
"Tell me about the teaching, please explain—
That God was once a man on another plane?"

[Music nearly stops - single piano]

President Hinckley, nineteen ninety-seven:
"I don't know that we teach it—path to heaven"
"I don't know that we emphasize it much"
"I don't know a lot about it and such"
"I don't think others know a lot about it too"

[Pause]

The great secret... forgotten, through and through.

[Final Chorus - Returns to epic with ironic edge]
[Full arrangement crashes back in]
God himself was once as we are now—
(Or so the prophet taught with solemn vow)
You have got to learn to be gods, don't you see?
(Unless we don't teach it anymore, maybe?)
The head of the gods called a council to meet—
(But we don't emphasize it on the street)
This is the secret that made us unique—
(Now hidden from the investigators we seek)

[Extended Outro - Atmospheric, unresolved]
[Choir returns with "Ahhhh"]
[Piano plays motifs from the chorus]
[Strings swell and fade]

Eighty-one days between the sermon and the death
The king gave his folly one final breath
"I am learned," he said, "more than all the world"
But now his great secret lies unfurled
Taught for a century, then put away
The gods of the council have nothing to say

[Soft spoken word over fading music]
"If I fail to do it,
It becomes my duty
To renounce all further pretensions
To be a prophet..."

[END]4170 / 7500

4933bf03-f6af-4f2f-a6b3-11afc30f6106.title: Digital Cowboys
4933bf03-f6af-4f2f-a6b3-11afc30f6106.description: Where Silicon Valley meets the Grand Ole Opry. An electro-country fusi
4933bf03-f6af-4f2f-a6b3-11afc30f6106.lyrics:
In this neon-lit saloon where the circuits meet the dust
There's a story 'bout connection and a heart that learned to trust
Silicon valleys meet the valleys where the tumbleweeds still roll
Where the data streams like whiskey and it burns right through your soul

The satellites are watching from that big Montana sky
While the servers hum a lonesome tune that makes the angels cry

We're digital cowboys riding frequencies instead of trains
Downloading our emotions through these fiber optic veins
The prairie meets the future where the old and new collide
In this electronic honky-tonk, there ain't nowhere to hide

Got my boots upon the floorboard of this self-driving Chevrolet
While the GPS is singing all the songs of yesterday
The banjo's playing breakbeats and the fiddle's gone electric
This modern kind of heartbreak is beautifully synthetic

They say the West was won with pistols and gold
But now we're mining bitcoins and the story's retold
From Nashville to the network, from the ranch to the cloud
We're country boys with keyboards and we're coding out loud

We're digital cowboys riding frequencies instead of trains
Downloading our emotions through these fiber optic veins
The prairie meets the future where the old and new collide
In this electronic honky-tonk, there ain't nowhere to hide

So here's to all the dreamers in their pickup trucks with screens
Living somewhere in between their granddad's world and laser beams
We're keeping tradition while the world is going quantum
In this techno-country fusion, we've got more than we could want from

We're digital cowboys, yeah, we're riding on the wireless plains
Streaming all our stories through these electronic chains
Where the campfire is a laptop and the cattle are all code
This is country music traveling down the information road1809 / 7500

6e6681fe-5375-4dcc-9efc-3b92d176a735.title: Eternal Resonance
6e6681fe-5375-4dcc-9efc-3b92d176a735.style: orchestral trance, symphonic electronic, classical-dance fusion
6e6681fe-5375-4dcc-9efc-3b92d176a735.lyrics:
[Intro: Epic orchestral strings building tension, 16 bars]
[Timpani roll into electronic drop]
[Layer: Baroque harpsichord arpeggios meeting 138 BPM trance baseline]

[Build 1: Symphonic crescendo with rising synth filters]
[Vocal sample - ethereal, processed: "Time... eternal... infinite"]
[Add: Staccato violins trading phrases with acid TB-303 patterns]

[Drop 1: Full orchestral hits synchronized with kick drum]
[Counterpoint: Fugue-style string section against rolling bassline]
[Layer: French horns calling and responding to synthesizer leads]

[Breakdown: Solo cello melody over ambient pads]
[Whispered vocals: "In the space between silence and sound"]
[Build tension with tremolo strings and rising white noise]

[Build 2: Add choir samples - wordless, angelic]
[Layer: Piano arpeggios in classical progression]
[Electronic elements gradually overtaking acoustic]

[Drop 2: Maximum energy - full orchestra meets peak-time trance]
[Countermelody: Oboe solo weaving through synthesizer sequences]
[Add: Brass stabs on off-beats, creating syncopation]

[Bridge: Deconstructed - only harpsichord and 808 kicks]
[Processed vocal: "Where classical meets eternal"]
[Slowly reintroduce elements: strings, then synths, then percussion]

[Final Build: Pachelbel's Canon progression in trance arrangement]
[Layer upon layer: Each orchestral section joining the electronic symphony]

[Climax: Everything drops except massive orchestral chord and reverb tail]
[Single vocal line: "Resonance... eternal... infinite"]
[Beat returns with double-time hi-hats and string pizzicato]

[Outro: Gradually strip back to solo violin and fading kick drum]
[Final element: Cathedral reverb on last orchestral note]
[End: Complete silence for 2 bars, then single piano note]1758 / 7500

fea8ab3c-b792-4753-8dd0-113b3ecdb0c0.lyrics:
[Shimmering Cold Intro]
. . . ! . .

[Verse 1 - Frosted, Breathy]
Spent too many nights with silence
Frost is crawling up my walls
I've been cold, I've been patient
But tonight I'm done with cold

[Pre-Chorus - Heat Building]
No more waiting
Done with shaking
I want somebody

Every second feeling colder

[Pre-Chorus - Urgent]
No more waiting
Done with shaking
I want somebody
To melt... this... freeze

[Chorus - Hotter, Layered]
Lonely's getting old, I'm done with the cold
No more frozen sheets, I want someone to hold
I won't stay in the dark, I'll chase the heat tonight

(Done with lonely nights)

[Bridge - Strip to Pulse, Then Build]
Lonely had me frozen
(Frozen, frozen...)
But I'm about to thaw
(Thaw, thaw...)

[Final Chorus - Full Heat, Explosive]
Lonely's getting old, I'm burning through the cold!

(No more, no more)
Done with lonely...

ff4ea206-0d85-4071-83ef-84d2f9ba8d51.title: The Reckoning
ff4ea206-0d85-4071-83ef-84d2f9ba8d51.lyrics:
[Rousing Intro]
. ! . ! . !
. ! . ! . !

[Verse 1]
Citizens of Hancock County
Hear me now, I call to you
The tyrant sits upon his throne
And what will you do?

[Verse 2]
Since the days of Nero and Caligula
There has not walked the earth
A blacker or a baser scoundrel
Than the one who claims divine birth

[Pre-Chorus]
Will you stand idle while he builds his kingdom?
Will you watch while freedom dies?
Or will you rise up in your majesty
And sweep the tyrant from the skies?

[Chorus]
Citizens arise!
Arise in the majesty of your strength!
Citizens arise!
We will go to any length!
Sweep the influence of tyrants
From the face of this good land
As with the breath of heaven
Citizens, take your stand!

[Break]
. ! . ! . !

[Verse 3]
The August election approaches
Prepare for the dreadful conflict now
Not with rifles, not with sabers
But with the ballot and the vow

[Verse 4]
Repeal the Nauvoo Charter
Strip the tyrant of his shield
Let the laws of Illinois
Make him answer, make him yield

[Chorus]
Citizens arise!
Arise in the majesty of your strength!
Citizens arise!
We will go to any length!
Sweep the influence of tyrants
From the face of this good land
As with the breath of heaven
Citizens, take your stand!

[Bridge - the rescue]
We call upon you now
Come to the rescue of this land
Before the Constitution falls
Into a single tyrant's hand
The remedy is in your power
The ballot is your sword
In August we will strike the blow
And answer to the Lord

[Final Chorus - battle cry]
Citizens arise!
Arise in the majesty of your strength!
Citizens arise!
The day of reckoning's at length!
We'll sweep the influence of tyrants
From the face of this good land
As with the breath of heaven!
Citizens! Take your stand!

[Outro - rallying]
Take your stand!
Take your stand!

ba50afac-5de3-4cc0-b5fc-041906cb35b3.lyrics:

. . . . . .

They sealed the men to multiple wives
In temples across the land
"For time" was ended, "eternity" wasn't

d8a6d046-e086-4e8a-b636-a2b1f6577907.title: SUDDEN DAY
d8a6d046-e086-4e8a-b636-a2b1f6577907.lyrics:
[Gentle Intro - from ashes]
. . . . . .
. . . . !

[Verse 1]
They said the facts would slumber
In the dark caverns of midnight
They said if they scattered the type
The words would lose their might

[Verse 2]
They burned the press on the river
They thought they'd won the war
But lo, it is sudden day
And we're singing what they swore

[Pre-Chorus]
A departed spirit cries for vengeance
From across the years
The tender tree, the thunder-struck
The silenced hopes and fears

[Chorus]
Sudden day
The dark deeds shall be known
Sudden day
From the house-tops it is shown
You can scatter the type
You can burn the page
But the story finds a voice
In every age
Sudden day

[Break]
. . . ! . .

[Verse 3]
One hundred eighty years
And still the story breathes
The women and the witnesses
The widows and the thieves

[Verse 4]
Jane Law still says no
Austin Cowles dares not teach
The great throat still swallows
But the remedy's in reach

[Chorus]
Sudden day
The dark deeds shall be known
Sudden day
From the house-tops it is shown
You can scatter the type
You can burn the page
But the story finds a voice
In every age
Sudden day

[Bridge - the album's thesis]
The remedy can never be applied
Unless the disease is known
So we sing what they testified
We carry what they've sown
For everyone who crossed the ocean
For everyone who died unnamed
For every tender tree that withered
We will not let them be ashamed

[Final Chorus - full, triumphant, all voices]
Sudden day!
The dark deeds shall be known!
Sudden day!
From the house-tops it is shown!
They scattered the type
They burned the page
But the story found a voice
In every age
And it will find a voice
In every age
Sudden day
Sudden day
Sudden day

[Outro - resolving to quiet hope]
Lo... it is sudden day...
The disease is known...
The remedy applied...

[End]1809 / 7500

61312d3a-eead-4bfd-a79a-ede579f7b3d6.title: THE BURNING
61312d3a-eead-4bfd-a79a-ede579f7b3d6.lyrics:
[Ominous Intro]
. . . ! . .
. . . . ! .

[Verse 1]
Three days after the press had run
The council met at night
The Mayor declared a nuisance
What we had printed in the light

[Verse 2]
One hundred men marched to the shop
Under the marshal's command
They pulled the press into the street
By order of his hand

[Pre-Chorus]
They thought if they could burn the words
The words would cease to be
They thought if they could kill the press
They'd kill the memory

[Chorus]
The burning, the burning
They set the truth on fire
The burning, the burning
They built a funeral pyre
Scattered type like ashes
Papers turned to flame
But you cannot burn a story
You cannot burn a name

[Break]
. . ! . . .

[Verse 3]
The flames lit up the river
The smoke rose to the sky
One hundred men stood watching
As the Expositor died

[Verse 4]
But seventeen days later
At Carthage they would fall
The men who burned the paper
Had written on the wall

[Chorus]
The burning, the burning
They set the truth on fire
The burning, the burning
They built a funeral pyre
Scattered type like ashes
Papers turned to flame
But you cannot burn a story
You cannot burn a name

[Bridge - consequence]
They wanted silence
They got a martyrdom
They wanted the story buried
But the story had just begun
June tenth they burned the press down
June twenty-seventh they died
And the words they tried to murder
Walked out the other side

[Final Chorus - triumphant through grief]
The burning, the burning
They set the truth on fire
The burning, the burning
They built their own pyre
The type is scattered, the paper ash
The press is torn apart
But the story lives in every mouth
And beats in every heart

[Outro - haunting, then resolving]
You cannot burn a name...
You cannot burn a name...
(Lo, it is sudden day...)

[End]1778 / 7500

f38f731a-e341-4420-88cb-e5f696dbce96.title: HABEAS CORPUS
f38f731a-e341-4420-88cb-e5f696dbce96.lyrics:
[Urgent Intro]
. ! . ! . !
. ! . . ! .

[Verse 1]
A man runs from the federal law
A warrant on his head
He crosses into Nauvoo
And the warrant's good as dead

[Verse 2]
The Mayor's court convenes at once
Habeas corpus cried
The federal marshal turned away
The fugitive walks free inside

[Pre-Chorus]
What good are the laws of the Union
If one city sets them aside?
What good is the Constitution
When Nauvoo decides who's tried?

[Chorus]
Habeas corpus
The body shall be produced
Habeas corpus
But here the law's reduced
To a tool for the protection
Of every fugitive
Who brings enough spoils to Nauvoo
For the privilege to live

[Break]
. ! . ! . .

[Verse 3]
The city council passed a law
That any man arrested here
Falls under Nauvoo's jurisdiction
No matter why he's near

[Verse 4]
A sink of refuge they have built
For every offender who can pay
The paramount laws of the Union
Set at defiance every day

[Chorus]
Habeas corpus
The body shall be produced
Habeas corpus
But here the law's reduced
To a tool for the protection
Of every fugitive
Who brings enough spoils to Nauvoo
For the privilege to live

[Bridge - warning to government]
Will the federal government be quiescent?
Will they let their laws be defied?
Will they watch while a city on the river
Builds a kingdom where criminals hide?
If the law means nothing in Nauvoo
Then the law means nothing at all
And every charter that protects a tyrant
Is a crack in the Republic's wall

[Final Chorus - accusatory]
Habeas corpus
Twisted from its purpose
Habeas corpus
A shield for every vice
They've turned a right of freedom
Into a criminal's device
And Nauvoo sits like a sovereign nation
Where the federal law won't reach
A city-state upon the Mississippi
Beyond the Constitution's breach

[Outro - ominous]
Beyond the law...
Beyond the law...

[End]1813 / 7500

037ee37d-c35d-453d-9a8b-df2d295b00fd.title: THE INQUISITION
037ee37d-c35d-453d-9a8b-df2d295b00fd.lyrics:
[Tense Intro]
. . . ! . .
. . ! . . .

[Verse 1]
On a Thursday evening in April
A council met in secret session
Unknown to the church they served
They passed their condemnation

[Verse 2]
William Law was tried that night
His brother Wilson too
And sister Jane beside them both
Cut off before they knew

[Pre-Chorus]
Our law condemnest no man
Until he has been heard
But they were tried and sentenced
Without a single word

[Chorus]
The Inquisition has returned
In Nauvoo on the river
What Innocent and Dominic began
Joseph Smith delivers
Tried in secret, condemned in shadow
Cut off without a voice
This is not the law of God
This is a tyrant's choice

[Break]
. . ! . .

[Verse 3]
Condemned on testimony
From a man who'd confessed a liar
No witness, no defense
Just the council and the fire

[Verse 4]
More formidable and terrible
Than Rome could ever be
An inquisition on the Mississippi
Where no one hears your plea

[Chorus]
The Inquisition has returned
In Nauvoo on the river
What Innocent and Dominic began
Joseph Smith delivers
Tried in secret, condemned in shadow
Cut off without a voice
This is not the law of God
This is a tyrant's choice

[Bridge - warning]
If this is suffered to exist
Then no one here is safe
Today they came for William Law
Tomorrow for your faith
The Spanish Inquisition
Burned heretics at the stake
But this new inquisition
Burns your name before you wake

[Final Chorus - accusatory]
The Inquisition has returned
In Zion on the hill
What Innocent and Dominic began
Joseph perfects still
No trial, no jury, no defense
No chance to face your crime
Just a council in the darkness
And your name erased from time

[Outro - haunting]
Erased from time...
Erased from time...

[End]1708 / 7500

10228a53-bc0e-443f-89f5-0768105a323d.title: KING AND LAWGIVER
10228a53-bc0e-443f-89f5-0768105a323d.lyrics:
[Driving Intro]
. ! . ! . !
. ! . ! . .

[Verse 1]
He stands as Prophet of the church
He sits as Mayor of the town
He rides as General of the Legion
And now he wants the nation's crown

[Verse 2]
Church and state were meant to stand
As separate as the sea from land
But here in Nauvoo they have merged
Into one man's command

[Pre-Chorus]
We disapprobate, we discountenance
Every attempt to unite
The power of God with the power of man
Is a tyranny in plain sight

[Chorus]
We will not acknowledge any man
As king and lawgiver to the church
Christ is our only king
Christ alone we serve
You can wear your general's sash
You can seek the president's chair
But we will not bow to any man
Who claims that God put him there

[Break]
. ! . ! . .

[Verse 3]
The Legion marches at his word
Three thousand strong in uniform
The city council does his will
The courts bend to his form

[Verse 4]
Political power and influence
Preposterous and absurd
When one man holds the sword and seal
And claims to speak God's word

[Chorus]
We will not acknowledge any man
As king and lawgiver to the church
Christ is our only king
Christ alone we serve
You can wear your general's sash
You can seek the president's chair
But we will not bow to any man
Who claims that God put him there

[Bridge - declaration]
We pledge ourselves to put him down
Not by violence but by vote
To strip the political power
From around the prophet's throat
Keep church and state divided
As the founders meant them be
No man should rule both heaven and earth
In a land that's meant for free

[Final Chorus - anthemic]
We will not acknowledge any man
As king and lawgiver to the church!
Christ is our only king!
Christ alone we serve!
You can wear your crowns of glory
You can claim the voice of God
But we will not kneel to tyranny
Dressed in a prophet's robe!

[Outro - resolute]
Christ alone...
Christ alone...

[End]1876 / 7500

b81dd2e3-fdfb-4a2a-930e-574f75754cec.title: THE GREAT THROAT
b81dd2e3-fdfb-4a2a-930e-574f75754cec.lyrics:
[Groove Intro]
. ! . ! . !
. ! . ! . !

[Verse 1]
They preached the gathering in haste
Sacrifice and come
Sell everything you have back home
And bring the money when you run

[Verse 2]
They bought the land for pennies
Sold it back for ten times more
And every dollar that you carried in
Went walking out their door

[Pre-Chorus]
Where did the money go?
Where did the tithes all flow?

[Chorus]
Down the great throat
From whence there's no return
Down the great throat
Where all your savings burn
They swallowed up the widows
They swallowed up the poor
Down the great throat
And still they wanted more

[Break]
. ! . ! . .

[Verse 3]
We looked for property belonging
To the church we built with blood
We found the temple standing
And nothing else but mud

[Verse 4]
The deceitfully-gotten gains
Absorbed into the night
In a very short time you're worse
Than before you saw the light

[Chorus]
Down the great throat
From whence there's no return
Down the great throat
Where all your savings burn
They swallowed up the widows
They swallowed up the poor
Down the great throat
And still they wanted more

[Bridge - accounting]
Ten thousand miles you traveled

[Final Chorus - bitter]

No return...

[End]1660 / 7500

a5ca0607-8880-4fee-89e6-d22566a8db2c.title: MANY GODS
a5ca0607-8880-4fee-89e6-d22566a8db2c.lyrics:
[Expansive Intro]
. . . ! . .
. . . . ! .

[Verse 1]
They taught us there were many gods
Above the God we knew
Innumerable thrones in heaven
And our God was subject too

[Verse 2]
As far above us as He is
There are gods above Him still
And if He varies from the law
He'll be cast down, they said He will

[Pre-Chorus]
Cast down as Lucifer was cast
From heights we cannot see
What kind of God can fall from grace?
What kind of God can cease to be?

[Chorus]
Many gods, they said
Many gods above
Many thrones in heaven
And ours is not enough
They spoke of God
In ways I cannot bear
Impious and irreverent
As if He was not there

[Break]
. . ! . . .

[Verse 3]
They said that we could rise
To godhood of our own
That men could be exalted

[Verse 4]

What hope is there for man?
If even He is subject

[Chorus]
Many gods, they said
Many gods above
Many thrones in heaven
And ours is not enough

In ways I cannot bear
Impious and irreverent
As if He was not there

[Bridge - rejection]
This is not the faith I crossed the ocean for

[Final Chorus - declarative]
Many gods? 
I answer: One
Many thrones?
There's only One

[Outro - firm]
One God...
One God...

[End]1588 / 7500

e8fc7980-ad1b-4367-b20e-a067dc1a131f.title: THE REVELATION
e8fc7980-ad1b-4367-b20e-a067dc1a131f.lyrics:
[Deliberate Intro]
. . . ! . .
. . . . ! .

[Verse 1]
I sat in the High Council
When Hyrum took the stand
He said he had a revelation
Given by the Prophet's hand

[Verse 2]
He read it to the council
Every man sat still as stone
The doctrine of a plurality
Of wives to call your own

[Pre-Chorus]
And I heard it with my own ears
I saw it with my own eyes
I cannot deny what I witnessed
I will not repeat their lies

[Chorus]
The revelation said
A man may take more wives
The revelation said
David and Solomon were justified
The revelation said
Sealed against all sins
I heard it read aloud
And I could not say amen

[Break]
. . ! . .

[Verse 3]
More wives than one, it said
In this world and the next
Virgins for the marrying
By prophetic pretext

[Verse 4]
And sealed to eternal life
Against all sins but one

Or consenting it be done

[Chorus]
The revelation said
A man may take more wives
The revelation said
David and Solomon were justified
The revelation said
Sealed against all sins
I heard it read aloud
And I could not say amen

[Bridge - moral crisis]

I was called to save souls

I dared not play this role

How could I seal their daughters

[Final Chorus - resolute]
The revelation said

The revelation claimed

I dared not...

a5f0bd5e-7d83-4b7d-8bbf-2353edaa9d13.title: UNDER CONDEMNATION
a5f0bd5e-7d83-4b7d-8bbf-2353edaa9d13.lyrics:
[Ominous Intro]
. . . ! . .
. . ! . . .

[Verse 1]
They said it was a revelation

[Verse 2]

Under condemnation

Under condemnation

No witness, no appeal

[Chorus]
Under condemnation
If I refuse
Under condemnation
If I hold true

Damned if I speak
Under condemnation

[Bridge - building, defiant]

And Jane Law said no

[Final Chorus - powerful, declarative]
Under condemnation?

Under condemnation?
I will not pretend!
You can damn me to your hell

But I will not bow to blasphemy

[Outro - resolute]
I will not bow...
I will not bow...

[End]1589 / 7500

86691f97-49c0-4c6a-b492-6cbcb5570ea2.title: SEVEN WIVES
86691f97-49c0-4c6a-b492-6cbcb5570ea2.lyrics:
[Sparse Intro - almost mocking]
. . ! . .

[Verse 1]

[Verse 2]

[Pre-Chorus]

[Chorus]
Seven wives

Taught in secret

To the lie fall from his tongue
Seven wives
And he could only find one

[Break]
. . . ! .

[Verse 3]
But we had read the revelation

[Verse 4]
David and Solomon had many wives

Seven wives
When I can only find one
Taught in secret
Denied in the sun

cc51bd8c-695e-4536-9b3f-2135543650e4.title: FORBEARANCE
cc51bd8c-695e-4536-9b3f-2135543650e4.lyrics:
[Building Intro]
. . ! . . .
. . . ! . .

[Verse 1]
We sought a reformation
Without a public word
We thought if he would listen
Repentance would be heard

[Verse 2]
We came to him in private
We pleaded and we prayed
We said we'd seize his hand in fellowship
If he would turn away

[Pre-Chorus]
But our petitions were treated with contempt
The petitioner spurned from his door

[Chorus]
Forbearance has ceased to be a virtue
And hope of reformation's vain
We called upon him to repent
He said he'd rather be damned
He'd rather be damned
Than lose his dignity

[Break]
. . ! . .

[Verse 3]
He said that we would go to Hell
Together, him and us
And there we'd cast the Devil out
And make a heaven of the dust

[Verse 4]
He said that Hell's an agreeable place
Not what the fools suppose
So let him have his kingdom there
We choose a different road

[Chorus]
Forbearance has ceased to be a virtue
And hope of reformation's vain
We called upon him to repent
He said he'd rather be damned
He'd rather be damned
Than lose his dignity

[Bridge]
How long should righteous men stay silent?
How long endure the lie?
When the wolf stands at the pulpit
And the sheep begin to die?

[Final Chorus - intense, declarative]
Forbearance has ceased to be a virtue
And hope of reformation's vain!
We called upon him to repent
He said he'd rather be damned
He'd rather be damned!
So let the truth be known!

[Outro - resolute]
Let the truth be known...
Let the truth be known...

[End]1463 / 7500

69de3a39-56a1-471b-ae45-dcbe438e6bf4.title: JUNE 7, 1844
69de3a39-56a1-471b-ae45-dcbe438e6bf4.lyrics:
[Cinematic Intro]
. . . ! . .
. . . . ! .
. . ! . . !

[Verse 1]
It is with the greatest solicitude
For the salvation of the human family
And of our own souls
That we have this day assembled

[Verse 2]
No man knows better than we do
The rise, the fall, the history
We stood beside him in the beginning
We saw what he became

[Pre-Chorus]
We called upon him to repent
He said he'd rather be damned
Forbearance has ceased to be a virtue
And hope of reformation... vain

[Chorus]
June seventh, eighteen forty-four
The press runs once and never more
We gird our armor, draw the sword
The sword of truth
We hazard everything we have
Our property, our very lives
But the remedy cannot be applied
Unless the disease is known

[Instrumental Break]
. . ! . . !
. ! . . ! .

[Verse 3]
We appeal to the arm of Jehovah
The supreme arbiter of the world
For the rectitude of our intentions
Let God be our witness

[Verse 4]
Freedom of speech, liberty of press
The right to worship as we choose
These rights we will not surrender
To any man who calls himself a prophet

[Chorus]
June seventh, eighteen forty-four
The press runs once and never more
We gird our armor, draw the sword
The sword of truth
We hazard everything we have
Our property, our very lives
But the remedy cannot be applied
Unless the disease is known

[Bridge]
Lo, the wolf is in the fold
Arrayed in sheep's clothing
Spreading death and devastation
Among the saints
We say to the watchmen on the walls
Cry aloud and spare not
For the day of reckoning is at hand

[Final Chorus - building, anthemic]
June seventh, eighteen forty-four
The press runs once and never more
We gird our armor, draw the sword
The sword of truth!
We hazard everything we have
Our property, our very lives
The remedy cannot be applied
Unless the disease is known!

[Outro - slower, resolute]
The disease is known...
The disease is known...

[End]1874 / 7500

31ff36cc-e9d4-4cb0-aabe-7f4a80081c74.title: THE TENDER TREE
31ff36cc-e9d4-4cb0-aabe-7f4a80081c74.lyrics:
[Sparse Intro]
. . . . . .
. . . . .

[Verse 1]
They sent me far away
Until the talk died down
I came back like a stranger
As from a long visit

[Verse 2]
My heart a fortress
Captured, sacked, and left
The charm of life has ended
The desire has failed

[Chorus]
I am the tender tree
The pride and beauty of the grove
Graceful in form
Bright in leaf
But the worm preys at my heart
And I am withering

[Instrumental Break]
. . . . . .

[Verse 3]
My rest is broken now
Sleep poisoned by dreams
Dry sorrow drinks my blood
Until my body sinks

[Verse 4]
They'll say it was a chill
Some casual disease
But no one knows the malady
That made me easy prey

[Chorus]
I am the tender tree
The pride and beauty of the grove
Graceful in form
Bright in leaf
But the worm preys at my heart
And I am withering

[Bridge]
Robbed of what only death restores
Shedding leaf by leaf
I fall in the stillness of the forest
And no one knows the cause

[Final Verse - whispered/fading]
A departed spirit
Cries out for vengeance
From the silence of the grave
From the silence...

[Mournful Outro]
. . . . .
. . . .
. . .

[Fade to End]1108 / 7500

8e147196-5f20-463d-8ddd-d0577b9ba69c.title: TEN THOUSAND MILES
8e147196-5f20-463d-8ddd-d0577b9ba69c.lyrics:
[Gentle Intro]
. . . ! . .
. . . . ! .

[Verse 1]
I heard them preach of Zion
A city built on light
They said that God was calling
From across the sea

[Verse 2]
I sold my mother's ring
I said goodbye to friends
I packed my life in one small trunk
And walked down to the shore

[Chorus]
Ten thousand miles to save my soul
Ten thousand miles to Zion
I left behind the only world I knew
Ten thousand miles to glory
Ten thousand miles alone
God was waiting on the other side
Or so they told me

[Violin Break]
. . . ! . .

[Verse 3]
The ocean stretched forever
The waves like rolling hills
I prayed each night for land
And dreamed of streets of gold

[Verse 4]
When I reached the river city
They welcomed me with smiles
They said hold fast, be faithful
Great blessings wait for you

[Chorus]
Ten thousand miles to save my soul
Ten thousand miles to Zion
I left behind the only world I knew
Ten thousand miles to glory
Ten thousand miles alone
God was waiting on the other side
Or so they told me

[Bridge]
They said the Prophet wished to see me
To reveal the mysteries of heaven
I thought that I would learn of God
I did not know what waited

[Final Chorus - slower, with foreboding]
Ten thousand miles to save my soul
Ten thousand miles to Zion
I left behind the only world I knew
Ten thousand miles...
Ten thousand miles...
And no way home

[Fading Outro]
No way home...
(No way home...)

[Fade to End]1401 / 7500

09440126-dda5-41b6-9bd5-e209b3215900.lyrics:
[Sparse Intro]
. . . ! . .
[Verse 1]
A room beside the river
A warning on the door
They swore me into silence
With death if I should tell
[Verse 2]
He said God had revealed it
That I belonged to him
That David and Solomon
Had many wives before
[Pre-Chorus]
Positively no admittance
Positively no escape
[Chorus]
Thunder-struck
I fainted, I refused

Everything I gave

God's will be done... not mine

. . . . ! .
. . . ! . .

What remains when God himself

d8fe901b-b135-48cf-9852-9cefb475aef6.title: The Rocks Remember
d8fe901b-b135-48cf-9852-9cefb475aef6.style: Acoustic folk rock song in a minor key, featuring a male vocalist with a smooth, melancholic baritone, The instrumentation includes acoustic guitar, upright bass, and a subtle drum kit with brushes, The chord progression is primarily diatonic, creating a somber yet reflective mood, The song structure follows a verse-chorus format with an instrumental bridge, The melody is simple and memorable, emphasizing the narrative quality of the lyrics, Production elements include a warm, natural reverb on the vocals and instruments, creating an intimate and organic sound, The tempo is moderate, around 90-100 BPM, The song begins with a solo acoustic guitar intro, followed by the introduction of vocals, bass, and drums in the first verse, The chorus features a slightly more dynamic arrangement with increased vocal intensity, The instrumental bridge showcases a melodic acoustic guitar solo, The outro fades out with the acoustic guitar and bass
d8fe901b-b135-48cf-9852-9cefb475aef6.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
They taught me that the world was young
Six thousand years from where we've come
Every begat and generation told
From Adam's dust to days of old

[Verse 2]
The prophet said from the pulpit high
You've waited six thousand years for this time to arrive
The most valiant spirits saved
For the latter days
And everyone believed him
That's just how it stays

[Chorus]
And I don't know how to unsee
What the mountains have shown me
The starlight traveled so far to arrive
How can we say
We're the first ones alive

[Verse 3]
But I've held fossils in my hands
Pressed into stone from ancient sands
And I've seen canyons cut so deep
With stories older than we keep
The ice remembers every year
A hundred thousand winters clear
The light from galaxies so far was already old before we are

[Verse 4]
They said that death began with Eve
That nothing died before the leaf
But something's buried in that stone
That lived and died and turned to bone
And when I asked about the bones
The giant creatures turned to stone
They said those dinosaurs weren't here
They rode in on a different sphere
God built this world from other parts
From broken planets' cosmic shards
The fossils hitched a ride, they said
From worlds already long since dead
And I don't know how to hold on
To a story so far gone
When the answer takes more faith than the question ever did
And we're still telling it to kids

[Bridge]
Six thousand years of waiting, they
The most righteous spirits anyway
That's what they told us we should be
But the universe disagrees

[Chorus]
And I don't know how to go back
To a world so small and flat
When the universe keeps whispering its age
And we keep tearing out the page

[Outro]
Six thousand years
That's what they said
But the rocks remember longer
Than the books we've read
(ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-2239 / 7500

9b51bd1b-13cb-4358-8de6-0d54c2d13b41.title: The Prophet's Batting Average (Part 2): The Strikeouts Continue
9b51bd1b-13cb-4358-8de6-0d54c2d13b41.lyrics:
[Playful Intro]

[Spoken Word Narration]
Welcome back, ladies and gentlemen!
You thought we were done? Oh no no no...
The prophet had MORE to say!

[Verse]
Up on the moon there's folks, he said
Six feet tall and nearly a thousand years not dead!
Dressed like Quakers in their lunar home
But Armstrong landed... and found 'em gone!

[Break]

[Chorus]
Two false prophecies, now we're countin' more!
(Deuteronomy says!)
When a prophet speaks and misses the score
(The Lord didn't say!)
Step right up, the list keeps growin'
The prophet's batting average... ain't worth knowin'!

[Piano Break]

[Verse]
Christmas Day, eighteen thirty-two
A Civil War prophecy came through
"South Carolina!" - got that one right...
But a newspaper said it four days prior to that night!

[Break]

[Verse]
Britain would join and call on nations more
Then slaves would rise up and settle the score
End of ALL nations would come to be...
But we're still here in twenty-twenty-five!

[Brass Break]

[Chorus]
Three false prophecies, now we're countin' more!
(Deuteronomy says!)
When a prophet speaks and misses the score
(The Lord didn't say!)
Step right up, the list keeps growin'
The prophet's batting average... ain't worth knowin'!

[Interlude]

[Verse]
His firstborn son would translate the plates one day!
A prophecy that God gave... so they say
But the baby was stillborn, eighteen twenty-eight
That golden prophecy... met a cruel fate!

[Break]

[Verse]
The Kirtland bank would prosper if you're true!
Keep the commandments and blessings come to you!
But the Safety Society crashed and burned
Half the leadership left... a lesson learned!

[Build]

[Ensemble Chorus]
Four false prophecies, now we're countin' more!
(Deuteronomy says!)
When a prophet speaks and misses the score
(The Lord didn't say!)
Step right up, the list keeps growin'
The prophet's batting average... ain't worth knowin'!

[Interlude]

[Verse]
A temple in Far West, Missouri ground
July eighteen thirty-eight, lay the cornerstone down!
But the mobs drove them out, the lot sits bare
A hundred eighty years... and no temple there!

[Break]

[Verse]
"If you live to eighty-five, Joseph my son..."
"You'll see the Son of Man before you're done!"
Killed at thirty-eight in Carthage Jail
(Oops!)
That's another prophecy... that set sail!

[Build]

[Ensemble Chorus]
Five! Six! Seven! We keep countin' more!
(Deuteronomy says!)
When a prophet speaks and misses the score
(The Lord didn't say!)
Step right up, the list keeps growin'
The prophet's batting average... ain't worth knowin'!

[Outro]
Some say prophets sometimes miss...
(Just a little!)
But the Bible says it don't work like this!
(Not even one!)
One false word in the Lord's own name
And the prophet title... goes up in flame!

[Spoken Word Narration]
So there you have it, folks...
Part one, part two, and we could keep going!
But who's counting?
(Deuteronomy is!)

[Sad Trombone]
waaah-waaah-WAAAH!

[Fade to End]2923 / 7500

4176c379-9122-4e72-93d8-3231e52245c9.title: One Edition Only
4176c379-9122-4e72-93d8-3231e52245c9.description: The Nauvoo Expositor published ONE edition exposing Joseph Smith's pol
4176c379-9122-4e72-93d8-3231e52245c9.lyrics:
William Law was a counselor
Till the prophet wanted more
Asked to marry William's wife
William showed him to the door!

April 1844
Both excommunicated fast
William said "I'll tell the truth"
"About his polygamous past!"

One edition! (That's all it took!)
One edition! (Just take a look!)
Exposed the secrets he was hiding
The plural wives, the kingdom rising!
One edition only!
June the 7th, 1844!
One edition only!
Then they smashed it to the floor!

Pooled their money, bought a press
Printed all the prophet's lies
Joseph read it, called the council
"This must never see more eyes!"

"It's a public nuisance now!"
"We must act with righteous fury!"
Called the Legion, smashed the press
(Skipped the part about a jury!)

One edition! (That's all it took!)
One edition! (Just take a look!)
Destroying it made everything worse
The coverup became the curse!
One edition only!
And the state said "That's illegal!"
One edition only!
Now you're heading to Carthage Jail!

Twenty days from print to death
The math is pretty clear
If he'd let the paper stand
He might have lived another year!

One edition! (That's all it took!)
One edition! (Just take a look!)
June 7th it hit the stands
June 27th his blood's on their hands!
One edition only!
The coverup destroyed the man!
One edition only!
Should have stuck with the original plan!

The Nauvoo Expositor!
One edition was enough!
Sometimes the coverup
Is so much worse than all the stuff!1436 / 7500

39ec1155-9e1f-4277-8648-2d089c2b1234.title: NOBODY OWNS THE SUN
39ec1155-9e1f-4277-8648-2d089c2b1234.description: You say December 25th belongs to one religion? That date was already a
39ec1155-9e1f-4277-8648-2d089c2b1234.lyrics:
You got a tree inside your house
Covered up in lights
You've been drinking since December started
Feasting every night
You've got wreaths upon your windows
Candles burning bright
And you say it all belongs to Jesus
Well... that's not quite right

See, humans have been gathering
Since long before your book
Watching for the sun's return
Go on and take a look -

Nobody owns the sun! (No they don't!)
Nobody owns December! (No they don't!)
The earth has always tilted
And we've always remembered
The trees, the lights, the gifts, the date?
Just humans celebrating
Nobody owns the sun
So let's all join in together!

December twenty-fifth, you say
Belongs to just one birth?
That was already a holiday
For everyone on earth
The Romans and the Norsemen
The Celts and Persians too
Everyone was celebrating -
Long, long before you

The sun returns, the light comes back
It doesn't check your creed
Every human in December
Has always felt that need -

Nobody owns the sun! (No they don't!)
Nobody owns December! (No they don't!)
The earth has always tilted
And we've always remembered
The trees, the lights, the gifts, the date?
Just humans celebrating
Nobody owns the sun
So let's all join in together!

Evergreen trees? Ancient Egypt
Yule log? Scandinavia  
Gift-giving? Saturnalia
Candles? Hanukkah, and way-way-back-ia
Mistletoe? The Druids kissed
Wreaths? The Romans made a list
Feasting in the darkest night?
Every human who survived the ice!

December twenty-fifth?
That was Sol Invictus Day
Fifteen hundred years of parties
Before the manger and the hay

Nobody owns the sun! (No they don't!)
Nobody owns the winter! (No they don't!)
The earth has always tilted
And we've always remembered

So when they say "put Christ back in Christmas"
Or "keep the reason for the season"
Tell them the reason IS the season -
The axial tilt's the reason!

We don't need to fight about it
There's no war to win
The solstice has always been for everyone
So let everybody in!

Nobody owns the sun!
But everybody needs the light
Nobody owns December!
So let's share it every night!

Merry Solstice! Happy Yule!
Io Saturnalia!
Happy Hanukkah! Merry Christmas!
Whatever gets you through!

Nobody owns the sun! [Clap clap]
Nobody owns the sun! [Clap clap]
The sun belongs to everyone -

70c58e07-cb0b-4507-93b4-f21150d59066.title: THE LONGEST NIGHT
70c58e07-cb0b-4507-93b4-f21150d59066.description: "The Winter Solstice is the reason for the season... We're quite willi
70c58e07-cb0b-4507-93b4-f21150d59066.lyrics:
The Winter Solstice has been celebrated by humans for at least ten thousand years—long before any of the religions practiced today existed. Our ancestors noticed that the days grew shorter as winter approached, and they didn't know if the sun would return. So they gathered, lit fires, decorated with evergreens (the only plants that stayed alive), and celebrated when the days began to lengthen again.
The Romans called their celebration Saturnalia—a week of feasting, gift-giving, and candle-lighting from December 17-25. December 25 itself was "Dies Natalis Solis Invicti" - the Birthday of the Unconquered Sun.
When Christianity spread through the Roman Empire, church leaders strategically placed Christmas on December 25 to absorb the existing pagan celebrations. As James Frazer wrote in The Golden Bough: "The coincidences of the Christian with the heathen festivals are too close and too numerous to be accidental."
The Yule log. The decorated tree. Holly and mistletoe. Gift-giving. Candles in the darkness. Feasting with family. These are all pagan traditions that predate Christianity by centuries or millennia.
This song celebrates the real reason for the season: the astronomical event that our ancestors marked with wonder. The Earth tilts on her axis, the days grow short, and then - they turn. The light returns. No miracle required. Just physics. And that's worth celebrating.
Happy Solstice.
